caption:
This photograph captures a scenic view of a waterfall cascading over a man-made dam. The dam, having a straight top, stretches across the frame, and the water overflows along the entire width of the dam, creating a consistent, smooth curtain of water. Below the dam, the water churns into a foamy, vigorous whitewater indicating strong currents and turbulence. The river appears wide and full, and the water has a muddy brown color, suggesting it might be carrying a significant amount of sediment.

The surroundings visible in the upper parts of the image show urban infrastructure, including a concrete structure parallel to the dam and a few buildings partially obscured by distance and foliage. A tree branch intrudes into the frame from the bottom left corner, adding a natural element to the otherwise industrial scene. 

The photograph portrays a sense of powerful, uncontrolled natural force being harnessed by human engineering.
title: Water pollution control facilities will be built at Nashua on the Nashua River. The project will be jointly assisted by the EPA Water Quality Office and the New Hampshire Water Supply and Pollution Control Commission.
